article.headline: Butler 88, Youngstown State 57
article.story: INDIANAPOLIS (AP) -- Jamie Smalligan, Avery Sheets and Nick Brooks scored 21 points apiece as Butler cruised to an 88-57 victory over Youngstown State Tuesday night in the first round of the Horizon League tournament. The scoring total was a season-high for Butler (15-13), which will face Wisconsin-Green Bay at home in the tournament's second round on Friday. The Bulldogs opened the game on a 20-6 run and shot 57 percent in the first half to open a 45-26 lead at halftime. Smalligan, who entered the game averaging four points, scored 18 points in the first half, topping his previous career high of 15. He set the tone early with four 3-pointers in the first half to finish 4-of-7 from behind the arc. Butler improved to 63 percent overall in the second half and led by as many as 34 points before a last gasp 3-pointer from Youngstown State's Allen Deep with nine seconds left accounted for the final score. Adam Baumann led Youngstown State with 21 points and was the only player to reach double figures for the Penguins (8-20). Andy Jahnke and Quin Humphrey each scored eight points.
